name: Infrastructure Security Configuration Evidence
description: Provide evidence that cloud infrastructure is configured with appropriate security controls including network security groups, encryption for data at rest and in transit, IAM role configurations, and multi-availability zone deployment for resilience.
guidance:
The infrastructure security evidence should demonstrate that:
i) Network security is implemented through properly configured security groups and firewalls that restrict traffic to necessary ports and protocols following least privilege principles.
ii) Data encryption is enabled for all data at rest using industry-standard algorithms (AES-256 or equivalent) and for data in transit using TLS 1.2 or higher.
iii) IAM roles and policies follow the principle of least privilege with appropriate segregation of duties.
iv) Production infrastructure is deployed across multiple availability zones to ensure high availability and resilience.
v) Infrastructure is defined as code and version controlled to ensure consistent and auditable deployments.

related_controls.name: Logical and Physical Access Controls
related_controls.description: The entity implements logical and physical access controls to protect information assets from unauthorized access.

related_policies.name: Infrastructure Security Policy
related_policies.description: Cloud Infrastructure and Network Security Policy establishing security requirements for infrastructure.

requirements: Network security group configurations showing restricted ingress/egress rules
Evidence of encryption at rest for databases and storage
Evidence of TLS encryption for data in transit
IAM role and policy configurations demonstrating least privilege
Infrastructure deployment across multiple availability zones
Terraform or IaC configurations showing security controls
Security group rules limiting access to specific ports and IP ranges
KMS or encryption key management evidence
acceptance_criteria: Network security groups follow default-deny, explicit-allow principle
All production databases encrypted at rest with AES-256
All API and web traffic uses TLS 1.2 or higher
IAM roles have minimal necessary permissions documented
Production services deployed in at least 2 availability zones
Infrastructure defined in version-controlled Terraform code
No overly permissive security rules (0.0.0.0/0 on sensitive ports)
Encryption keys properly managed and rotated
data_sources: Load balancer and multi-AZ deployment evidence
